PARAM.name: radio_if_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

COMMAND.name: show wlan ap security
COMMAND.help: Specific WLAN Access Point Security Information

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

COMMAND.name: show wlan ap ac
COMMAND.help: Specific WLAN Access Point Security Information

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

PARAM.name: radio_if_name
PARAM.help: Name of Interface

PARAM.name: radio_if_name
PARAM.help: Interface Name

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: Enables or disables the radio.

PARAM.name: arg_value2
PARAM.help: Comma-separated list of strings. Each list item MUST be a member of the list reported by the SupportedStandards parameter. (a/b/g/n/ac) e.g., "b,g,n"

PARAM.name: arg_value3
PARAM.help: The value indicates the frequency band at which the radio is operating. (2.4GHz/5GHz)

PARAM.name: arg_value4
PARAM.help: The 802.11d Regulatory Domain. First two octets are two-character country code. The third octet is either " " (all environments), "O" (outside) or "I" (inside). e.g., "US "

PARAM.name: arg_value5
PARAM.help: The current radio channel used by the connection.

PARAM.name: arg_value6
PARAM.help: Enable or disable automatic channel selection.

PARAM.name: arg_value7
PARAM.help: The Modulation Coding Scheme index (applicable to 802.11n and 802.11ac specifications only).

PARAM.name: arg_value8
PARAM.help: The guard interval value between OFDM symbols (applicable to 802.11n and 802.11ac specifications only). (400nsec/800nsec/Auto)

PARAM.name: arg_value9
PARAM.help: Indicates the bandwidth at which the channel is operating.(20MHz/40MHz/80MHz/160MHz/Auto)

PARAM.name: arg_value10
PARAM.help: Enable or disable automatic Coc.

PARAM.name: arg_value11
PARAM.help: Number of antennas

PARAM.name: arg_value12
PARAM.help: Comma-separated list of strings. The set of data rates, in Mbps, that have to be supported by all stations that desire to join this BSS. e.g., "1,2"

PARAM.name: arg_value13
PARAM.help: Comma-separated list of strings. Maximum access point data transmit rates in Mbps for unicast frames. e.g., "1,2,5.5,11"

PARAM.name: arg_value13
PARAM.help: Indicates the current transmit power level as a percentage of full power.

PARAM.name: arg_value14
PARAM.help: Indicates whether IEEE 802.11h functionality is enabled on this radio.

PARAM.name: arg_value15
PARAM.help: The secondary extension channel position, applicable when operating in wide channel mode.(AboveControlChannel/BelowControlChannel/Auto)

PARAM.name: arg_value16
PARAM.help: Enable or disable high throughput space-time block code.

PARAM.name: arg_value17
PARAM.help: Enable or disable high throughput low-density parity-check code.

PARAM.name: arg_value19
PARAM.help: 11n protection

PARAM.name: arg_value20
PARAM.help: Enable or disable fast path.

PARAM.name: arg_value21
PARAM.help: Enable or disable radar simulation channel.

PARAM.name: arg_value22
PARAM.help: The type of preamble.(short/long/auto)

PARAM.name: arg_value23
PARAM.help: Time interval (in ms) between transmitting beacons.

PARAM.name: arg_value24
PARAM.help: This specifies the number of beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacon frames containing a TIM element whose DTIM Count field is 0.

PARAM.name: arg_value25
PARAM.help: This indicates the number of octets in an MPDU, below which an RTS/CTS handshake is not performed.

PARAM.name: arg_value26
PARAM.help: This specifies the current maximum size, in octets, of the MPDU that can be delivered to the PHY.

PARAM.name: arg_value27
PARAM.help: The maximum number of retransmissions of a short packet i.e. a packet that is no longer than the RTSThreshold.

PARAM.name: arg_value28
PARAM.help: This indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame, the length of which is greater than RTSThreshold, that will be made before a failure condition is indicated.

PARAM.name: arg_value40
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value41
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value42
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value43
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value44
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value45
PARAM.help: in bytes/s (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value47
PARAM.help: Integer? (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value49
PARAM.help: Integer? (0-65535)

PARAM.name: arg_value51
PARAM.help: in seconds

PARAM.name: arg_value53
PARAM.help: Integer? (0-65535)

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Interface Name

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: Enables or disables this access point.

PARAM.name: arg_value2
PARAM.help: Whether WMM support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames.

PARAM.name: arg_value3
PARAM.help: The maximum number of devices that can simultaneously be connected to the access point. A value of 0 means that there is no specific limit.

PARAM.name: arg_value4
PARAM.help: Enables or disables device isolation.

PARAM.name: arg_value5
PARAM.help: Whether U-APSD support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames.

PARAM.name: arg_value7
PARAM.help: Indicates whether or not MAC Address Control is enabled on this WiFi.

PARAM.name: arg_value8
PARAM.help: Comma-separated list of MACAddresses.

PARAM.name: arg_value12
PARAM.help: in seconds

COMMAND.name: set ap security
COMMAND.help: Configure security related settings that apply to a CPE acting as an Access Point

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Interface Name

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: Indicates which security mode is enabled. (None/WEP-64/WEP-128/WPA-Personal/WPA2-Personal/WPA-WPA2-Personal/WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise/WPA-WPA2-Enterprise)

PARAM.name: arg_value2
PARAM.help: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. WEPKey is used only if ModeEnabled is set to WEP-64 or WEP-128. A 5 byte WEPKey corresponds to security mode WEP-64 and a 13 byte WEPKey corresponds to security mode WEP-128. e.g., 123456789a

PARAM.name: arg_value3
PARAM.help: A passphrase from which the PreSharedKey is to be generated, for WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal or WPA-WPA2-Personal security modes. e.g., test_passphrase

PARAM.name: arg_value4
PARAM.help: A literal PreSharedKey (PSK) expressed as a hexadecimal string.PreSharedKey is only used if ModeEnabled is set to WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal or WPA-WPA2-Personal.

PARAM.name: arg_value5
PARAM.help: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this access point.

PARAM.name: arg_value6
PARAM.help: Enables or disables proprietary WPS functionality for this access point.(Configured/Unconfigured)

PARAM.name: arg_value7
PARAM.help: Enables or disables management frame protection for this access point.

PARAM.name: arg_value8
PARAM.help: The interval (expressed in seconds) in which the keys are re-generated.

PARAM.name: arg_value9
PARAM.help: The IP Address of the RADIUS server used for WLAN security.

PARAM.name: arg_value10
PARAM.help: The port number of the RADIUS server used for WLAN security.

PARAM.name: arg_value11
PARAM.help: The secret used for handshaking with the RADIUS server

PARAM.name: arg_value12
PARAM.help: The IP Address of a secondary RADIUS server used for WLAN security.

PARAM.name: arg_value13
PARAM.help: The port number of the secondary RADIUS server used for WLAN security.

PARAM.name: arg_value14
PARAM.help: The secret used for handshaking with the secondary RADIUS server.

COMMAND.name: set ap ac
COMMAND.help: Configure WiFi QoS related settings that apply to a CPE acting as an Access Point

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: Interface Name

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Best Effort Traffic (Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value2
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Background Traffic (Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value3
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Video Traffic (Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value4
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Voice Traffic(Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value5
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Best Effort Traffic (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value6
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Background Traffic (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value7
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Video Traffic (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value8
PARAM.help: Exponent of Contention Window, Voice Traffic (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1.

PARAM.name: arg_value9
PARAM.help: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number), Best Effort Traffic. This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

PARAM.name: arg_value10
PARAM.help: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number), Background Traffic. This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

PARAM.name: arg_value11
PARAM.help: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number), Video Traffic. This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

PARAM.name: arg_value12
PARAM.help: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number), Voice Traffic. This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

PARAM.name: arg_value13
PARAM.help: Maximum transmit opportunity for Best Effort Traffic, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

PARAM.name: arg_value14
PARAM.help: Maximum transmit opportunity for Background Traffic, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

PARAM.name: arg_value15
PARAM.help: Maximum transmit opportunity for Video Traffic, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

PARAM.name: arg_value16
PARAM.help: Maximum transmit opportunity for Voice Traffic, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

PARAM.name: arg_value13
PARAM.help: Ack Policy for Best Effort Traffic, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge

PARAM.name: arg_value14
PARAM.help: Ack Policy for Background Traffic, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge

PARAM.name: arg_value15
PARAM.help: Ack Policy for Video Traffic, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge

PARAM.name: arg_value16
PARAM.help: Ack Policy for Voice Traffic, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge

COMMAND.name: set ssid
COMMAND.help: Configure SSID related settings that apply to a CPE acting as an Access Point

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: The textual name of the SSID entry as assigned by the CPE.

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: The current service set identifier in use by the connection. e.g., test_ssid

PARAM.name: radio_if_name
PARAM.help: radio interface name

PARAM.name: SSID
PARAM.help: Enter new SSID here

PARAM.name: arg_value1
PARAM.help: Indicates which security mode is enabled. (None/WEP-64/WEP-128/WPA-Personal/WPA2-Personal/WPA-WPA2-Personal/WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise/WPA-WPA2-Enterprise)

PARAM.name: arg_value2
PARAM.help: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. WEPKey is used only if ModeEnabled is set to WEP-64 or WEP-128. A 5 byte WEPKey corresponds to security mode WEP-64 and a 13 byte WEPKey corresponds to security mode WEP-128. e.g., 123456789a

PARAM.name: arg_value3
PARAM.help: A passphrase from which the PreSharedKey is to be generated, for WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal or WPA-WPA2-Personal security modes. e.g., test_passphrase

PARAM.name: arg_value4
PARAM.help: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this access point.

PARAM.name: arg_value5
PARAM.help: Enables or disables proprietary WPS functionality for this access point.

PARAM.name: arg_value6
PARAM.help: Enables or disables management frame protection for this access point.

PARAM.name: ssid_name
PARAM.help: The textual name of the SSID entry as assigned by the CPE.
